floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
River levels remain high but steady on the Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster due to recent heavy rainfall.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel.
No further rainfall is forecast.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 27/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River levels continue to remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to recent heavy rainfall and will remain so for several days.
Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. River levels also remain high at the Keswick Campsite; Lodore gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 27/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are high but gradually falling on the River Thame as a result of sustained rainfall last week. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Thame Bridge area. Scattered showers are forecast today which will clear this evening. We expect river levels to gradually fall over the next couple of days. Our staff are in the area clearing trash screens. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 

This message will be updated this evening, 26 September 2023, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has now been removed. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Continue to take care on coastal roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
